data.text:
Profession: Film Director

Biography: Martin Scorsese is an influential film director, screenwriter and producer, part of the "new Hollywood" group of filmmakers that include Francis Ford Coppola, Steven Spielberg and George Lucas.

Scorsese's earliest success was "Mean Streets", his first of many films working with Robert De Niro. He followed this up with "Taxi Driver" (1986) with De Niro in the title role. The film won the Palme d'Or at Cannes and was nominated for Best Picture.

"Raging Bull" (1980) also starred De Niro who won Best Actor and was again nominated as Best Picture. It is often regarded as the best film of the 1980s.

Many successful films has followed including "Goodfellas", "Casino" and "Gangs of New York". "The Departed" finally broke Scorses's infamous Oscar drought, earning him a Best Director Academy Award in 2006.

Scorsese's films are known for their themes of organised crime, Italian-American identity and Catholic guilt. Scorsese's film career has also been marked by a number of long term relationships with actors including De Niro and Leonardo DiCaprio.

Born: November 17, 1942

Birthplace: New York City, New York, USA

Age: 81 years old
